org.ff4j.core

Interface FlippingStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFlipStrategy, BlackListStrategy, ClientFilterStrategy, DarkLaunchStrategy, ExpressionFlipStrategy, OfficeHourStrategy, PonderationStrategy, ReleaseDateFlipStrategy, ServerFilterStrategy, WhiteListStrategy

    public interface FlippingStrategy
    Each feature should implement the flipping strategy. (enabling/disabling will be handle by flipper.
    Author:
    Cedrick Lunven (@clunven)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean evaluate(String featureName, FeatureStore store, FlippingExecutionContext executionContext)
      Tell if flip should be realized.
      Map<String,String> getInitParams()
      Initial Parameters required to insert this new flipping.
      void init(String featureName, Map<String,String> initParam)
      Allow to parameterized Flipping Strategy

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(String featureName,
          Map<String,String> initParam)
        Allow to parameterized Flipping Strategy
        Parameters:
        featureName - current featureName
        initValue - initial Value

      • getInitParams

        Map<String,String> getInitParams()
        Initial Parameters required to insert this new flipping.

      • evaluate

        boolean evaluate(String featureName,
                 FeatureStore store,
                 FlippingExecutionContext executionContext)
        Tell if flip should be realized.
        Parameters:
        featureName - target featureName
        executionContext - custom params to make decision
        Returns:
        if flipping should be performed
